image.altText: Health care worker Desleigh Shields listens to a patient's heartbeat.

props.synopsis: The first drop of Closing the Gap target data for 2024 provides updates for eight of the 19 socio-economic targets, showing the agreement is not on track.

title.children: Latest Closing the Gap data shows only five out of 19 targets are 'on track'. Will the next generation get a fair go?

image.altText: Nikki Haley stands at a podium bearing her name in front of a row of American flags.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's last rival for the Republican presidential nomination suspends her US presidential campaign but stops short of endorsing the former president, arguing he needs to "earn the votes" of Americans who don't support him.

title.children: Nikki Haley suspends presidential campaign, leaving Donald Trump as last major Republican candidate

image.altText: A woman looks on with her hands behind her head.

props.synopsis: The manager of Sam Kerr's Women's Super League club says the Matildas star has its "full support", after she was charged with the racially aggravated harassment of a police officer in London.

title.children: Sam Kerr has English club's 'full support', as criminal charge looms over star

image.altText: A woman sits at her table in front of an iPad.

props.synopsis: Retirement living advocates say the number of older Canberrans will increase by 75 per cent in the next two decades, and more needs to be done to accommodate them in housing and health.

title.children: Current housing infrastructure won't cope with 'silver tsunami' of older Canberrans, advocates say

subjects.title: Assisted Living and Long Term Care

image.altText: Katy Gallagher at a budget press conference

props.synopsis: Parents accessing the government funded paid parental leave (PPL) scheme will soon be offered superannuation, but the change isn't set to come into place until the middle of next year.

title.children: Super to be added to paid parental leave if Labor government wins next election

image.altText: Sally Dowling SC in a white blazer and blue top

props.synopsis: The director of public prosecutions, Sally Dowling SC, has ordered an audit of every sexual assault case committed for trial following criticism from some judges that merit-less cases were being pursued

title.children: Every sexual assault case in NSW set for trial to be reviewed following judges' criticism

image.altText: Trees and a river from above.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's outgoing president is leaving his utopian vision for a jungle capital to his successors to build. Will they pull the plug?

title.children: The $45 billion headache Indonesia has created deep in the jungles of Borneo

image.altText: A woman in a blue police shirt stares ahead

props.synopsis: The shocking murder of Jesse Baird and Luke Davies should be a wake-up call to police forces across the country that for too long have been failing to take action against serving officers who commit domestic violence.

title.children: Police have a problem with domestic violence in their ranks. What will it take to fix it?

props.synopsis: In a statement Australian Defence Force said first aid was rendered at the scene.

title.children: Soldier in hospital after parachuting incident during 'routine' training exercise

image.altText: People work at desks in an airy room, sitting in front of computers.

props.synopsis: Deloitte Access's Stephen Smith says newly released GDP figures show that "while Australia is not in a recession, many Australians are in a recession".

title.children: After 13 rate hikes, Australia's GDP growth has slowed to a crawl. Will mass unemployment follow?

image.altText: Joe Biden and Donald Trump do thumbs-up signals in two separate images.

props.synopsis: Nikki Haley's departure from the field confirms the US election will be between two old men who are broadly disliked. And Super Tuesday has highlighted challenges for both Donald Trump and Joe Biden, writes North America correspondent Carrington Clarke.

title.children: Super Tuesday has set up a Trump-Biden rematch while highlighting challenges for both men

image.altText: an anonymous photo of a woman turned away from the camera in a children's playground

props.synopsis: Early in her marriage, Sophia went to the police after being controlled by her husband, but they didn't even interview her. It was years before she finally left him.

title.children: First Sophia's ex-husband banned her boots, then what she ate and who she saw

image.altText: A woman with a large coat on looks on, away from the camera, as snow falls

props.synopsis: These wives and mothers of Russia's mobilised soldiers are risking the ire of Vladimir Putin and the Kremlin with their weekly protests, which come at an awkward time for the president.

title.children: The women taking on Vladimir Putin, one flower at a time

image.altText: Portrait shot of Dr Ben Sessa.

props.synopsis: A leading UK psychiatrist, brought to Australia to train practitioners to deliver psychedelic therapy, has been suspended after admitting to having a sexual relationship with a vulnerable former patient.

title.children: Psychedelic trainer admits to relationship with vulnerable former patient who later took her own life

image.altText: Nuclear power station chimneys

props.synopsis: There's a reason why opposition parties often prefer to avoid producing actual policy alternatives until they absolutely must, writes David Speers.

title.children: Housing and energy problems aren't easy to solve – as Dutton and Chandler-Mather are learning the hard way

image.altText: Image shows congestion and traffic delays. You can see cars, grey road on a gloomy day.

props.synopsis: Australia's most popular car brands will struggle to meet carbon emissions limits from the year of their introduction, with market data revealing many face imposts of thousands of dollars per car in the years to come.

title.children: Half of car brands will fail to meet planned CO2 limits in their first year

image.altText: Matt Keogh and Richard Marles listen to a speaker at a defence event.

props.synopsis: Government ministers will today give evidence under oath to a long-running inquiry into military suicides, while an organisation representing elite special forces soldiers claims it hasn't been given an opportunity to appear.

title.children: Government to front veterans royal commission as soldiers warn of 'Canberra cover-up'

image.altText: Young man holding jaw in pain

props.synopsis: Wisdom teeth are our most meddlesome molars; evolutionary relics that can be more trouble than they're worth. But experts say any benefits associated with their removal must be weighed against the risks.

title.children: Wisdom teeth can be a pain, but is it always best to have them out?

image.altText: A graphic map of Australian showing the Great Artesian Basin and a "CO2" graphic with downward arrows.

props.synopsis: The Great Artesian Basin generates about $13 billion of product and supplies water to hundreds of towns, but a big coal company wants to store waste CO2 in it.

title.children: Should Australia's largest groundwater system be used to produce food or store waste CO2?

image.altText: Josh and Nick Daicos hold aloft the AFL premiership trophy in front of Collingwood fans at the MCG.

props.synopsis: This season shapes as one of the most fascinating in the AFL era, which means predicting who will lift the premiership trophy is fraught with danger, writes Cody Atkinson and Sean Lawson.

title.children: AFL fans need to strap themselves in as the 2024 season promises to be a wild ride

image.altText: A composite image shows photographs of a woman with a magnifying glass over one photo.

props.synopsis: The suspected homicide of a woman with disabilities is raising questions about how her disappearance slipped through the cracks.

title.children: Tanya Glover vanished. No-one reported her missing. 13 years later, her body was found

image.altText: Tasmania Police officers at Hutchins construction site where bones were found after excavations unearthed a historical grave

props.synopsis: The discovery of historical human remains at one of Hobart's most prestigious schools has caused equal parts alarm and intrigue — with one historian explaining many of the city's schools sit over cemeteries.

title.children: Gruesome discovery at Hobart school a consequence of city's practice of building over top of cemeteries

image.altText: A headshot of Karen who wears a red blazer and stands with a serious expression in a living room infront of an arched window.

props.synopsis: The peak body for GPs says female doctors are earning less than their male colleagues because they're more likely to take on appointments for things like mental health and antenatal care, which attract lower bulk billing incentives.

title.children: 'It's medical misogyny': Doctors say Medicare bulk billing incentives exacerbating GP gender pay gap

image.altText: Two images: Vladimir Putn speaking at a podium in front of a Russian flag, and Joe Biden speaking in front of a US flag

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin's spokesperson claims Russia has never interfered in a US election — but that's not what US intelligence officials believe.

title.children: Russia 'does not intend to interfere' in 2024 US presidential election, Kremlin says

image.altText: Three children sit with their hands cable tied. Their faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: Roger Cook says vision appearing to show children being cable tied together in the state's north is "disturbing" and "confronting" while the state's Children's Commissioner says she is "appalled" by the allegations.

title.children: WA's premier 'disturbed' by confronting vision of kids cable tied together in state's north

image.altText: A white woman with blonde hair in her late 40s wears a bright pink shirt and purple leggings and sits in a cow hide chair.

props.synopsis: It’s been a tough couple of years for the writer and theatre-maker, but she’s channelled her frustrations into adapting a 17th-century farce, and it’s a delightful romp.

title.children: Van was snubbed as a 'state school scrubber', now her second play is on at Sydney Theatre Company

image.altText: A woman with braids stands half in a denim shirt against a grey backdrop.

props.synopsis: The UK advertising watchdog backtracks on its decision to ban the ad, following criticism from the public and the singer herself.

title.children: 'We got it wrong': Controversial ban of FKA twigs Calvin Klein ad partially lifted in UK

image.altText: Matthew Richardson grimaces

props.synopsis: All athletes know what it is to drive themselves into the depths of pain in pursuit of victory, and sprint star Matt Richardson is something of an expert.

title.children: 'I can hurt my body in ways that 99 per cent of people can't': Matt Richardson embraces the pain of victory

image.altText: A woman writes well messages on the message board during the tenth annual remembrance event at a shopping mall.

props.synopsis: New deep-sea technology and different crash theories will be used as two more companies undertake bids to find the wreckage of doomed flight MH370.

title.children: 'Extremely rough terrain' flagged as new search area for MH370

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Roshni Lad laying on a hospital bed wearing a pink shirt with her husband Bhairav beside her.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne couple say they were "praying to God" for the safe delivery of their baby after being forced to pull over on the side of the road to give birth amid traffic chaos they say was caused by a climate protest on Tuesday.

title.children: Baby boy born on side of busy Melbourne road amid climate protest which caused traffic delay

image.altText: A wide shot of five men in suits and ties standing in a line, crossing their arms and joining hands while smiling

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese and South-East Asian leaders endorse a declaration that omits some language on China that Australia originally wanted included.

title.children: Australia and South-East Asian nations endorse watered-down declaration to strengthen regional ties

image.altText: former prison officer wayne astill sits outdoors at a cafe table

props.synopsis: Minister for Corrections Anoulack Chanthivong said a "broken culture" permitted Wayne Gregory Astill to commit sexual offences against inmates during his time working at Dillwynia Correctional Centre.

title.children: More than 30 recommendations made to fix Sydney 'viper pit' prison where former guard sexually assaulted inmates

image.altText: A medium shot of a middle-aged man in a suit and tie sitting in a chair

props.synopsis: The Italian, who is one of soccer's most successful coaches, is alleged to have used shell companies to hide parts of his income.

title.children: Real Madrid coach Carlo Ancelotti accused of $1.7 million tax fraud by Spanish prosecutors

image.altText: Colourful illustrations of five beautiful women. All wear either a dupatta, chador, niqab, khimar or jilbab

props.synopsis: For Muslim women, wearing the hijab can bring a sense of pride, but it can also attract racism as misconceptions and assumptions prevail. So, let's set the record straight.

title.children: The question Muslim women dread every summer
